snippet: A federal judge on Monday ruled that the stop-and-frisk practices of the New York Police Department in recent years violated the constitutional rights of New Yorkers by targeting young minority men for stops.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Monday ruled that the stop-and-frisk practices of the New York Police Department in recent years violated the constitutional rights of New Yorkers by targeting young minority men for stops.

headline.seo: Behind the Decision on the Stop-and-Frisk Policy
headline.main: Behind the Decision on the Stop-and-Frisk Policy
